Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the events for Case A1 and B2, I can see that each case starts with retrieving a raw metal sheet, scanning the barcode, placing it on a table, aligning, and preheating. These actions all seem to be part of preparing the material before any assembly happens.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So maybe the first high-level step is Material Preparation. That makes sense because they're handling the raw material, scanning it for tracking, positioning it, and preheating, which is likely a necessary step before assembly.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Next, after preheating, there's picking up a welding tool followed by welding corners A and B. Then measuring the weld integrity. These actions involve assembling parts together and checking the quality of that assembly.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: But wait, the measuring is done by a quality sensor. Does that belong in Assembly or Quality Inspection? Hmm. Maybe since it's immediately after welding and part of the same workflow, it could be part of Assembly as an inline check.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then there's applying a protective coating, drying it with another heating unit, and finally a visual check by an operator. The coating application and drying seem like finishing steps to protect the product.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: So breaking down: 1. Material Preparation: Retrieve raw material, scan barcode, place on table, align with robot arm, preheat. 2. Assembly: Pick up welding tool, weld corners A and B. 3. Inline Quality Check: Measure weld integrity. 4. Coating Application: Apply protective coating and dry. 5. Final Quality Inspection: Visual check.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Wait but in the sample log for A1: After welding corners A and B (done by Operator B), then Measure weld integrity (Quality Sensor #1) occurs at 08:01:20, then apply coating at 08:01:30. So maybe 'Measure weld integrity' is part of Assembly as an inline check before moving to the next step? Or is it part of a separate Quality Inspection phase?

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Alternatively, during assembly, include that measurement as part of assembly since it's verifying that step's success before proceeding? But given that resources differ here—Operator B does welding while Quality Sensor does measurement—it might indicate different phases handled by different resources/systems.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Proposed groupings: 1. Material Preparation: Retrieve raw material, scan barcode, place metal sheet on table, align, preheat. 2. Assembly: Pick up welding tool, weld corners A and B. 3. Post-Assembly Quality Check: Measure weld integrity. 4. Coating & Curing: Apply protective coating and dry. 5. Final Quality Inspection: Visual check.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: This way each high-level step groups actions with similar purposes or resources involved.
